def.dt: :a person whose job is to keep track of records and documents for a business or office a bank/office clerk a law clerk [=a person whose job is to assist a judge]

:an elected or appointed official whose job is to take care of official papers and business for a court or government Have the court clerk file your request with the judge. a city/town clerk [=a person whose job is to record what happens at city or town meetings and to keep special information about the city or town]
:a person who works in a store He works as a clerk in a local pet store. a grocery clerk a sales clerk at a women's clothing store
:a person who works at the main desk of a hotel assisting the people who are staying there a hotel clerk = a desk clerk
:to work as a clerk usually used of law clerks After graduating from law school, she clerked for a judge for several years.
